page.title: 01Land N E of Huntingdon
page.content: This block which overlooks the great Ouse Valley to the south is very largely cofined to arable farming, containing a few isolated farm houses and cottages. Much of the old hedgerows have been grubbed up leaving fields up to 100 acres which are more suitable to modern farming. Some releif is provided by a few copses of deciduous tree, which incidentally provide cover for pheasants. (c.f. St thomas's Dole Plantation). In sharp contrast, squares 9 and part of 10 have, since the 39-45 war been developed to provide housing, amenity services and sports areas, (there is a grey hound race track), to accommodate the increase in Huntingdon's population ("The London Overspill'). The Western end of R.A.F. Wyton accupies 1/2 sq km. of square 8. Work is due to begin next year on the
